TEI.2.document_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., The Austin Papers, (Austin: University of Texas Press, 1927), 3 vols., Vol 3, pp. 218-219
TEI.2.document_title: R R Royall to Stephen F Austin, 10-28-1835

barker_notes.barker_summary: Encouraged by reports from the front
barker_notes.barker_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., The Austin Papers, (Austin: University of Texas Press, 1927), 3 vols., Vol 3, pp. 218-219

div1.p: Encouraged by reports from the front

Your letters have Just arrived (of date 24th Inst) and the Council and citizens General are rejoiced at the flatering prospects of our cause We believe you will probably be 900 strong by the time this Reaches you We have nothing more to communicate except we still have confidence that Reinforcements may be relyed on as continuing to flow in.
[Addressed:] Genl. S. F. Austin Head Quarters Mr Baker
